intro: Eurygania multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered eurygania, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Eurygania multiflora produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
